item.title: Long Haul Voice, Video and Data via MPLS Networks
item.description: By: John Shepler Many businesses need to transmit voice, video, and data across long distances, whether between cities, across the country, or even internationally. While both the internet and dedicated private lines are viable options, there’s another solution you might not be familiar with: MPLS networks. This article will explore why MPLS is a strong option for long-distance data transport and how to decide which solution best suits your needs.

item.title: AT&T Sees the Video Tsunami Coming
item.description: Video streaming is predicted to consume massive amounts of bandwidth, pushing the limits of what’s available. Even the concept of “unlimited” bandwidth offered by providers today comes with hidden caps due to network strain. AT&T is one company actively addressing this challenge, not just by increasing general internet capacity but by adding 400 Gbps to its Content Delivery Network (CDN). Think of a CDN as a dedicated express lane running parallel to the public internet highway.
